title: Bobby Rankin
text:
Robert Rankin (7 April 1905 – 25 August 1954) was a Scottish <a href="association%20football">football</a> player and <a href="manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a>. He played for hometown club <a href="St%20Mirren%20F.C.">St Mirren</a> over two spells, and for <a href="Dundee%20F.C.">Dundee</a> and <a href="Clyde%20F.C.">Clyde</a>, mainly as an <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29%23Inside%20forward">inside left</a>. He gained three <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">caps</a> for <a href="Scotland%20national%20football%20team">Scotland</a> in 1929, scoring twice.
He later acted as a director of St Mirren then served as manager of the club for eight seasons from 1946 (plus one wartime campaign prior to that), and was still in the post when he died in 1954 aged 49.
